properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Early August Heavy Rainfall for Vancouver Island and the South Coast of British Columbia. An unseasonably strong Pacific front is poised to drench Vancouver Island and parts of the south coast beginning on Thursday. The system will tap into subtropical moisture which will amplify the front and help to enhance the rainfall. The main area of rain will begin over west and inland Vancouver Island Thursday morning. The rain will spread to areas of east Vancouver Island from Nanaimo to the Comox Valley, and over the Sunshine Coast later in the morning and will intensify and become heavy on Thursday afternoon. Over Howe Sound, Whistler, and northern sections of Metro Vancouver there may be some scattered showers on Thursday ahead of the main plume of moisture associated with the front. The main area of rain will develop later on Thursday afternoon and Thursday evening as the front moves eastward. The continuous rain will end Thursday night as the front pushes eastward. In the wake of the front, there will be showers with a risk of thunderstorms and gusty winds through Friday. There remains some uncertainty with respect to the location of where the heaviest precipitation amounts will occur. Stay tuned to Environment and Climate Change Canada for all the latest forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-01T13:50:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T05:51:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1885683284.2019
Area: West Vancouver Island, Inland Vancouver Island, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Whistler, Howe Sound, North Shore - including West Vancouver and North Vancouver, Metro Vancouver - northeast including Coquitlam and Maple Ridge
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:26 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is located 4 km northwest of Sylvan Lake and is moving towards the northeast at 30 km/h. This thunderstorm has a history a large hail, with storm spotters reporting toonie to golfball size hail around 9:00 PM near Sylvan Lake. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-01T06:25:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T03:27:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3316936645.2019
Area: Lacombe Co. near Lacombe Blackfalds and Bentley, Red Deer Co. near Sylvan Lake and Stephansson House
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots. Several areas of thunderstorms over Gulf-Magdalen may have the potential to give gale force wind gusts up to 35 kts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2019-08-01T08:14:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T01:12:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4045256215.2019
Area: Gulf - Magdalen
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Near zero visibilities in fog will continue into Thursday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-01T18:04:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T02:05:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3624932156.2019
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:54 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. At 10:50 pm, radar is indicating that thunderstorms in southern Manitoba are beginning to weaken. Subsequently, warnings have been paired back. However, there remains warnings out for a storm currently to the northwest of Snowflake and another to the south of Roseisle. These thunderstorms are tracking east to southeast at 20 to 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-01T06:34:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-01T03:55:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3837321689.2019
Area: Mun. of Louise incl. Pilot Mound and Crystal City, Mun. of Pembina incl. Manitou La Rivière and Snowflake, R.M. of Dufferin incl. Carman Roseisle and Homewood, R.M. of Thompson incl. Miami Rosebank and Deerwood
properties.Author: Environment Canada
